title: Chapter 393
content: # Chapter 393 "Dammit!" Chris slammed his fist against the table. The 3rd ranked user's pride towered as high as the heavens themselves. How could it not? Among two billion players, only two stood above him. Low self-esteem would be the true anomaly. Chris acknowledged his limits with exactly two people. Kraugel and Grid. Kraugel overwhelmed him with terrifying growth speed and impossible physical prowess. Grid possessed a legendary class beyond mortal craftsmanship. Everyone else fell below. *I can't believe Zibal jerked me around.* Chris gritted his teeth. Zibal ranked one spot higher, true. The man had fought evenly with Piaro at the gathering. But objectively? Zibal excelled at politics, not combat. He belonged beneath Chris in raw strength. Yet that same man had made a fool of him. The memory burned. Zibal raising doubts at the seven guild summit. Chris's credibility crumbling before the other leaders. His pride had shattered like cheap glass. Only one remedy existed. *I need to crush him. Completely.* The Giant Guild had once reigned supreme. Past tense. The Reinhardt golem invasion had gutted their strength. Now they ranked somewhere in the top three among the seven guilds. Maybe. A direct clash with the Snake Guild carried no guarantees. Worse, Zibal's allies would pile on. The entire Giant Guild risked isolation if Chris moved carelessly. One option remained. *The National Competition.* All seven guilds would gather there. Zibal. Seuron. The others who'd sided against him. *I'll trample every last one of them.* Chris clenched his jaw hard enough to grind teeth. He was still one of the world's strongest, farmer defeat notwithstanding. His true weapon wasn't his level. Not his control. Not even his items. It was **Tyrant**, his unique-rated second class. That power would be his salvation. *** Second classes changed everything. Huroi understood this truth intimately. Before acquiring **Apostle of Justice's Partner**, his combat ability had been pathetic. An orator fought with words, not steel. Books made poor weapons. Every crisis had forced him to rely solely on his silver tongue. "Hah... Hah..." The 31st island of the Behen Archipelago recreated past trials. Huroi's current nightmare? Being thrust back to level 73 with only his base orator class. Thirteen grey-mane wolves circled him. Level 85. Vicious attack power. Blinding speed. *This is impossible.* He had no sword. No second class skills. His stats were garbage. *How did My Lord overcome trials like these?* The thought of Grid steadied Huroi's racing heart. His master had endured worse and emerged victorious. That fact alone proved Grid's greatness. *I pledged him my absolute loyalty. I won't bring shame to that oath.* Huroi straightened his spine. Courage flooded his veins. If words were his only weapon, then words would suffice. "Your mother was a fox!" The wolves froze. Their mother... a *fox*? The insult struck deep. "Awooooo!" *Bark! Bark bark!* Rage consumed the pack. Huroi's **Spiteful Tongue** shredded their mental states, plunging them into shock. "Your father had a yellow mane!" "You're nothing but dogs!" "I turned your ancestors into jerky!" The verbal assault descended into mudslinging so crude that any listener would cringe. But Huroi fought with everything he had. *** "Haha." One month until the National Competition. Chairman Lim Cheolho finally had time to review the rankings after weeks buried in administrative work. He pulled up Grid's recorded footage from the 41st island. Was he impressed by Grid's growth? Not particularly. The Legendary Blacksmith's steady progress had become predictable. No, something else caught Lim Cheolho's attention. The clone. Grid's clone had died while in the Blackening state. According to system protocols, it should have dissolved instantly. Instead, it had fallen into Hell. "The clone became an independent entity, completely separate from Grid..." Lim Cheolho frowned. Had a bug slipped through? He'd created Satisfy, true. But not alone. To build something this vast with minimal errors, he'd delegated core operations to the supercomputer Morpheus. The clone's persistence after Blackening ended troubled him. He queried the system. > **[MORPHEUS]:** It isn't a bug. Z10B005 isn't a user. Therefore, he isn't subject to the rules of Blackening and Hell. "Hrmm... This situation is very interesting." Hell trembled at the arrival of Grid's clone. What changes would ripple through that realm? How would the clone evolve now that it existed independently? Lim Cheolho's excitement built. He couldn't wait to see what unfolded. *** > [You have entered the 50th island.] > [This is a save point. Would you like to register?] > [You have been registered. When you enter the Behen Archipelago later on, you will start from the 50th island.] Grid had tasted brutal adversity on the 41st island. Since then, he'd blazed through the next nine islands in record time. Victory brought no satisfaction. "The mobs are over level 360." Each island raised the monster levels. The 49th island spawned enemies between 360 and 370. At least 55 levels above Grid. Their base stats were exceptional. Their defense frustrated him. Fighting five-on-one against such creatures would leave ordinary rankers speechless. Grid found it lacking. *The stronger they get, the slower I hunt.* He pulled up his mental calculations. One month in reality. Ninety days in Satisfy. Could he reach the 66th island before the National Competition if this difficulty curve continued? *Doubtful.* "I need Fog Island." Grid checked his accumulated challenger points. 18,851. Enough to purchase the Weapons Mastery skill book and fifty-one elixirs. *Fifty-one elixirs.* Equivalent to fifty-one levels worth of stats. With Weapons Mastery and those elixirs, the Behen Archipelago's monsters would fall far more easily. *I can finally balance strength and agility one-to-one.* Piaro's stat distribution. Grid remained convinced that copying the legendary farmer's build would unlock new heights of power. *I won't imitate anyone else. Only Piaro.* Since Satisfy's launch, Grid had met only three beings who truly awed him. Vampire Duke Marie Rose. Great Magician Braham. And Piaro. Logic dictated that mimicking Piaro's distribution would yield strength. "Huhuhut!" *Ttang! Ttang!* Grid hammered away at his damaged equipment, laughter spilling freely. He imagined reaching Fog Island. Claiming his hard-earned rewards. Ascending to new power. He'd forgotten something crucial. His wishes rarely manifested as intended. *** > [You have entered the 51st island.] > [A mission will be created.] > **[51st Island]** > Defeat 10 golden crowns in 20 minutes. > First Clear Reward: 1,900 Challenger Points. *Golden crowns?* Grid had never encountered this monster type. The name itself was unfamiliar. "What fresh hell is this?" Despite his complaint, Grid's expression remained bright. Time attack missions played to his strengths. With his overwhelming attack power, speed clears were practically guaranteed. *Kkirik. Kik.* The island was small, rock walls rising in every direction. Grid prepared to activate Fly and search for his targets. Then he paused. Scratching sounds echoed from nearby. Grid drew the **Blue-Black Grid's Greatsword** and dropped into a combat stance. "Kyak!" A monster wearing a golden crown crashed down from the rock wall. Its massive club swung toward Grid's skull in the same motion. *Chaaeng!* Grid swept his greatsword horizontally, blocking the strike. He stepped forward into the monster's guard. *It hits like a truck.* The impact rattled his bones. The damage was absurd for a basic attack. Nearly skill-level force. A clean hit would cost him at least 6,000 health. "Doesn't matter." Grid had faced countless powerful enemies since becoming Pagma's Descendant. Common monsters like these? Trivial. "Pagma's Swordsmanship." *Chaaeng!* He deflected the club and closed the distance. "Kill!" *Puok!* The greatsword pierced the monster's heart. Green, bumpy skin split around the golden crown on its head. Perfect accuracy. > [You have dealt 1 damage to the target.] "What?" Grid's eyes widened. "Kyaooooh!" The golden crown counterattacked immediately. *Jjejeong! Jjejejeok!* Confusion would paralyze most players in this situation. Watching your strongest skills deal negligible damage tended to shatter confidence. But Grid possessed something valuable. Experience with the impossible. *I've dealt with worse.* *Jjeejeeeong!* The greatsword and club collided with a piercing shriek. Grid grimaced at the ear-splitting sound but kept his composure. His mind raced, analyzing the situation. *Every monster has a weakness.* He just needed to find it.
